Near Las Ramblas, Ra is a quaint little hipster haven with traditional Spanish fare...with an exotic and modern (read: Asian) twist. The menú del día is a steal for only €10,99 -- per usual in Spain: two courses, a dessert, and a drink. Their Cream of Spinach soup was delicious, but ran a bit cold. However, the crispy cheese bits and charred onion made up for it immensely. The second dish "entrama en salsa," a beef fillet with a fresh salsa/salad of peppers and tomatoes tasted light, but overall was nothing spectacular. The dessert of arroz con leche was a bit overly sweet, but was flavorful. Nothing a jarra de cerveza can't fix. Overall a great find in the heart of Barcelona for its ambience and unique cuisine.
